intro: Colletia spinosa var. assimilis, commonly known as the desert holly, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of South America. It features spiny, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically reduced to scales, reducing water loss through transpiration. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
